qas.question: What did Eastern Nigeria want to call itself as an independent nation?
When did Eastern Nigeria declare its independence?
Who led Eastern Nigeria during the Nigerian Civil War?
How many months did the Nigerian Civil War last?
How many people died during the Nigerian Civil War?

context: In <a1_0>May 1967<a1_0/>, the Eastern Region declared independence as a state called the <a0_0>Republic of Biafra<a0_0/>, under the leadership of <a2_0>Lt. Colonel Emeka Ojukwu<a2_0/>. The Nigerian Civil War began as the official Nigerian government side (predominated by soldiers from the North and West) attacked Biafra (Southeastern) on 6 July 1967 at Garkem. The <a3_0>30<a3_0/> month war, with a long siege of Biafra and its isolation from trade and supplies, ended in January 1970. Estimates of the number of dead in the former Eastern Region are <a4_0>between 1 and 3 million<a4_0/> people, from warfare, disease, and starvation, during the 30-month civil war.
